analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The reverse order of the law of conditionality, The Paṭṭhāna text in triplets and couplets

The two internal triads, The dyad of causes🔽With internal and not a cause as condition there arises external and a cause.🔽With external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause.

original: Naajjhattaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bahiddhā hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na ajjhattam na hetum dhammam paṭicca bahiddhā hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With internal and not a cause as condition there arises external and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.🔽With external and not a cause as condition there arises external and a cause.🔽With external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause.🔽With external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.

original: Nabahiddhā nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhatto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bahiddhā na hetum dhammam paṭicca ajjhattaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With internal and external and not a cause as condition there arises external and a cause.🔽With internal and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause.

With internal and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises external and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises external and a cause and internal and a cause.

original: Naajjhattārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattārammaṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … dve.
analyzed: na ajjhatta ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā dve
translated: With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.🔽With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.

original: Nabahiddhārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bahiddhārammaṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bahiddhā ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause as condition there arises internal and a cause and external and a cause.

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā dve …pe… purejāte āsevane dve …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā dve pe purejāte āsevane dve pe avigate cha
translated: With internal and not a cause and external and not a cause
